content: Cerity's enforced premium at quarter end was $3.8 million, which represents an increase of 280% over the last four quarters and was supported by its recent collaboration with Intuit's QuickBooks and more recently, Thimble. Gross premiums written were a $189 million versus $152 million a year ago, an increase of 24%. Net premiums earned were a $179 million versus $147 million a year ago, an increase of 21%. From a reporting segment perspective, our Employer segment had underwriting income of $3 million consistent with its underwriting income a year ago and its resulting calendar year combined ratio were 98% during each of those periods. Turning to investments, our net investment income was $24 million for the quarter versus $18 million a year ago, an increase of nearly 30%.
